p: The viral non-structural protein 1 (NS1) can block the processing of cellular pre-mRNA [ 24] and targets the polyadenylation tail of nascent cellular transcripts [ 25, 26], which in turn inhibits the nuclear export of mature mRNA and thus their translation. In contrast, the NS1 protein from IBV, as it lacks the carboxyl-terminal effector domain in comparison to IAV NS1, is not capable of inhibiting mRNA polyadenylation or nuclear export [ 27].
